Reviews/Synopsis
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Please go to the following website for detailed information:
 <a href="
http://www.hkfilm.net/movrevs2/shalevil2.htm" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.hkfilm.net/movrevs2/shalevil2.htm</a>

Ok, first off let me tell you this not a sequel to the previous Shaolin Vs. Evil Dead, this more of a prequel, so we don't get a continuation from the first movie's abrupt ending.
 I know this will disapoint some, I on the other hand, am an old school kung fu fan, so I felt the abruptness of the film's ending was a tribute to the old Shaw Brothers movies, many starring Gordon Liu, that end as soon as the evil one is vanquished.

Anyhow, this one is better than it's predessor, which I quite liked, less silly and humourus. The story is sharper, more of a story dealing with honour and chivalry, the best stuff in Asian movies, that's is of course, except for martial arts. This one has plenty of the fu, all of it incredibly well cheorographed.
 The special effects are also awesome, some truely amazing stuff that I haven't seen before. A liitle longer running time alows for more developement, and an ending with more closuer than the earlier effort.

Most of the principle cast returns, but it should be noted that the great Gordon Liu dosen't arrive until the third act. He dose however spend most of it in kung fu action, and he is still the main hero and star.
 Even if you watch him dubbed, he still has the charisma, and makes his appearance worth the wait.
